entry.title: [Autofill][Desktop] New VCN Enroll Loading View
entry.content:
This CL adds a new loading view to the vcn enroll bubble. After the vcn

enrollment is accepted by the user, the vcn enrollment bubble shows the

loading view that has a spinner at the right bottom, no (Ok, Cancel)

action buttons and a disabled close button. Loading view closes once the

server response for vcn enrollment is received. This CL also handles

reshowing bubble’s loading view if user clicks on a link.



Screenshot: http://screen/4J6C8wtWrrxnatF.png



Bug: 1499264

entry.title: Android: Fix MissingFormatArgumentException in FullscreenVideoPictureInPictureController Log.e()
entry.content:
Before 57075df787d1241c8b703e3a0e3fde45964da861, Log.e() calls that had

a Throwable as the last parameter would be passed to both

String.format() and android.util.Log.e(). After the commit it is passed

only to android.util.Log.e().



This changes a log statement that was relying on the parameter to be

sent to both.



Bug: 41495786

entry.content:
Updates tab strip colors.

- The `_fakeStatusBarView` user interface style needs to be manually

updated when switching to incognito.

- Separators in `TabStripCell` need to have a opaque background.

Otherwise when two separators are stacked, the alpha value of the visible separator becomes 0.6.

entry.title: Reland "[UNO] Change reconcilor behavior when user not signed in to chrome"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 3ba4805e4d5c68485cec63c5d5f835231d43089c



Original change's description:

> [UNO] Change reconcilor behavior when user not signed in to chrome

>

> This CL does the following:

> - Disables cookie updates/OAuthMultiLogin when the user is not signed in

> to chrome.

> - In the above mode, accounts in the cookie are the source of truth.

> Refresh tokens are updated to match the accounts in the cookie. If a

> refresh token doesn't have an account in the gaia cookie or the

> account is invalid (session expired) the refresh token is removed from

> chrome.

>

> Bug: b/320279580

entry.title: Initial setup for QuicProxyDatagramClientSocket
entry.content:
QuicProxyDatagramClientSocket will be responsible for making a CONNECT-UDP request and will use a QUIC stream to send and receive datagrams. It will be used in QuicSessionPool::ProxyJob where it will either be built around a new QUIC stream in the session or a preexisting one will be used for a new QUIC session.



This CL adds the barebones (constructors, variables, and unimplemented methods) for the QuicProxyDatagramClientSocket.



Next steps:

- Mock testing

- Implement ConnectViaStream

- Implement BuildTunnelRequest

- Read/Write operations using stream



Bug: 1524411

Change-Id: I40025968e2751fc768373b8c0c9533408df6b10e

entry.title: [GPU] Add and use HARDWARE_GRAPHITE GPU mode
entry.content:
The logic for GPU fallback currently doesn't take into account whether

Graphite is enabled. The logic works "accidentally" for platforms that

support fallback to software, because on repeated Graphite crashes the

mode will devolve from HARDWARE_{GL, VULKAN} to the software modes.



This CL makes this support explicit. It adds a new HARDWARE_GRAPHITE

mode and uses it as following:



* When Graphite is enabled, the initial mode is set as HARDWARE_GRAPHITE

* In that case, we do not fall back to Ganesh - instead, we fall back

directly to software

* When the GPU mode is not Graphite, we explicitly compute the

`grContextType` with Graphite disabled to ensure that the service

side does not see Graphite as enabled if Graphite is enabled but we

have fallen back from it



The last item is not strictly necessary as of this CL as we only fall

back from Graphite to software. However, it is conceptually correct

and sets the foundation for a followup CL that will introduce fallback

from Graphite to Ganesh-GL for platforms that don't support fallback to

software.



In this CL there is no functional change.



Followup CLs will do the following:

* Rework metrics to both take Graphite into account and give more

visibility on fallbacks overall

* Add Graphite->Ganesh-GL fallback on Android and ChromeOS

* Extend the GpuCrash_InfoForHardwareGpu test to verify fallback from

Graphite



Bug: 1507801

entry.title: Reland "ime/CharacterComposer: show preedit string in sequence mode"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 00e6672024727ed8a2127f5725f6c81db9d5703d.



The change caused a regression on ChromeOS, thus we now guard the

changes to be Linux-only. This change also keeps the original test case

and only changes the expectations for Linux, instead of deleting it

completely.



Original change's description:

> ime/CharacterComposer: show preedit string in sequence mode

>

> This patch updates CharacterComposer to show a preedit string in

> sequence mode; previously, a preedit string was only shown in hex mode.

>

> The rationale for this change is the following. The GTK IME, used by

> ozone/x11, shows a preedit string in sequence mode. By changing

> CharacterComposer's behaviour, this inconsistency between ozone/x11 and

> ozone/wayland (which uses CharacterComposer) is fixed.

>

entry.title: Signed estimated_capture_clock_offset converted to unsigned parameter.
entry.content:
I got an estimated end to end audio latency that shows time travel.

I see in the log that we get an clock offset estimation that looks wrong



I found this in a log file

```

Unexpected latency value: 1706893657264 - (1706893656951 + 4294967295993 + -56.12744140625) = -4294967295623.873

```

The 4294967295993 is supposed to be clock offset estimation received from an absolute capture time header extension in milliseconds. (4294967295993 - 2^32*1000) = -7, which is a reasonable value for the clock offset, so it's likely there's a signed/unsigned issue somewhere.



i'm pretty sure, this fixes the problem. estimated_capture_clock_offset is signed, since the offset can be positive and negative. But UQ32x32ToInt64Ms have an unsigned parameter. We should use the signed version, i.e. Q32x32ToInt64Ms. 



Bug: b/324013062

Change-Id: I7d8b20b34bb7be63791a4cf4a8b990e20541e41c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5260103

entry.title: [AvatarButton] Encapuslate decision making into the delegate
entry.content:
The goal is to reduce the back and forth between the button and the

delegate, which creates a complex stack.

The button primarily takes care of the UI modifications, but gets

it's dynamic information from the delegate which is aware of Chrome

and Profile modifications.

This CL encapsulates those decisions more within the delegate to get a

clearer flow, it only reorders some calls, no behavior change is

expected





Potential future changes:

- Further decrease the coupling by having the delegate notify

the exact changes to be applied, instead of requesting the info

after calling `UpdateText()` again.

- Try to simplify the `Identity animation` flow.

- Cleanup the intercept text showing; make it more generic as a way

to enfornce a specific text controlled by some external

structure/logic. (next CL)

entry.title: [iOS][Bookmark] Unify shortcut and in-browser bookmark’s snackbar.
entry.content:
When bookmarks are added from a iOS shortcut, the snack-bar will now:

* state the name of the folder in which the bookmark is saved, if it was set by the user previously.

* warns, when the user sync-bookmarks but those bookmarks is saved locally, that it won’t be synced.



It should be noted that strings are only changed in plural forms. In

singular form, the string remains the same. So using the same

screenshot is acceptable, as it only show singular. However, due to

presubmit that could not be overridden, this required to rename those

strings.



The only difference between the strings for the shortcuts and the

strings used in Chrome UI is that shortcuts show the number of added

bookmarks. The reason we don’t show this number in Chrome UI is that

if a bookmark folder is selected, we can’t know the number of

bookmarks in a synchronous fashion. Indeed, if the bookmark model is

deep, this number may take significant time to compute.



Fixed: 1518481

entry.title: Fix unhandled exception in FirstNonCapturedType.
entry.content:
We recently enabled the feature kAutofillUploadVotesForFieldsWithEmail

in Canary, that includes email votes on fields where the content matches

a valid email format, even if the address isn't already saved in any of

the user profiles.



This change caused an issue in the "FirstNonCapturedType" code section,

which previously assumed all filled field types would match an existing

(non-empty) type in the user's stored addresses. This led to a crash

(see linked bug).



This CL adds an exception for EMAIL_ADDRESS field types in

FirstNonCapturedType.



Fixed: b/41497271

entry.title: Decouple pending PDM query tracking
entry.content:
PDM::HasPendingQuery() indicates if it is currently waiting for the

result of some read request to the database. This CL splits this

function into HasPendingAddressQuery() and HasPendingPaymentsQuery().



It further splits PDM::is_data_loaded_ into is_address_data_loaded_ and

is_payments_data_loaded_. This bool is currently used to run

deduplication and emit metrics once the initial load has finished.

This CL decouples this logic and runs this logic once the initial

address/payments data load has finished.

To do so, LogStoredDataMetrics() is split into an address and a payments

function.



Decoupling this logic will make it easier to split the PDM into an

address and a payments data manager.



Bug: b/322170538

Change-Id: I28b38e18057c93a10058e38277707a816f975017

entry.title: device orientation: Switch CDP domain implementation to virtual sensors
entry.content:
The features provided by CDP's Emulation.setSensorOverrideEnabled() and

Emulation.setSensorOverrideReadings() commands are a superset of what

the DeviceOrientation domain provides, so we can switch the

implementation of those commands to a virtual sensors-based one that

lives in the content layer rather than Blink (as the code needs access

to classes in content/browser that mediate the access to virtual sensors

in //services).



The sensor functions in EmulationHandler are async and therefore cannot

be easily invoked from the newly-added DeviceOrientationHandler class,

so some code duplication was inevitable. This also means that if

DeviceOrientation.setDeviceOrientationOverride() has been called, it is

not possible to create a "relative-orientation" virtual sensor via

EmulationHandler, and vice-versa.



The DeviceOrientationInspectorAgent code in Blink was not entirely

removed, but it was considerably stripped down so that it just resets a

DeviceOrientationController's pump if required. The SensorInspectorAgent

code has been entirely removed.



Bug: 1506995

Change-Id: I36e62d7feaf0194c37795c5de016822f9d127cb9

entry.title: [URL] Support non-special URLs in ReplaceComponents()
entry.content:
Implement correct support for non-special URLs in

gurl::ReplaceComponents().



Example:



Prior to this change:



> const url = new URL("git://host/path")

> url.host = "hello";

> url.pathname = "world";

> url.href

"git://host/path"



After this change:



> const url = new URL("git://host/path")

> url.host = "hello";

> url.pathname = "world";

> url.href

"git://hello/world"



This CL also adds ParseNonSpecialURLInternal(...) functions with

`trim_path_end` parameter, which is required to support the following

tricky case, preserving a trailing whitespace in paths when removing a

hash.



> const url = new URL("git://host/path #a")

> url.hash = "";

> url.href

"git://host/path%20"



Note: The existing ParsePathURL(...) has a similar `trim_path_end` parameter.



Bug: 1416006

Change-Id: Ibc7aaed7a9b4a1ab608eb1d90e961f1cc8921c0c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5240153

entry.title: [passwords] Avoid distinguishing sync feature on vs off in SyncState
entry.content:
No behavioral change: pure refactoring to avoid subtle bugs in the

future.



Namely, callers that need to distinguish whether or not

sync-the-feature is on should do so using the semi-deprecated

(depending on platform) APIs. This is only a minority of the callers

that use sync_util::SyncState.

entry.title: exo: fix verified sync token cache and search.
entry.content:
SurfaceTreeHost stores previously verified sync tokens and checks if a

new frame has the same sync tokens. If it finds them, it sets them as

verified to avoid additional load on the IPC. However, after the

comparison operator was changed in the gpu::SyncToken, it started to

also compare the |verified_flush| flags. As a result, the

SurfaceTreeHost could never find any previously verified tokens. The fix

to this problem is easy - make a temp copy of the sync token to search

and set it as verified. Please note that original tokens are not

modified in this case.



Bug: 1520501

Change-Id: Ic3d52b23757caca6abb48fad11dd208eaba4f6c4

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5246288

Reviewed-by: Peter McNeeley

entry.title: MiraclePtr: Sample-guided unrewrite
entry.content:
This CL unrewrites an assortment of `raw_ptr` users who stand out in

stack samples. Specifically, we examine stack samples and filter by

stacks with `RawPtrBackupRefImpl` visible.



There is no fixed criterion for what to unrewrite and how seriously we

take the stack samples. Visible methods (and their weight) fluctuate

freely between versions. We simply try to get "quite a few of them," and

then we wait and measure the impact.



As for methodology, most of these were found either by cursory

inspection through CodeSearch or by stepping through a debugger to

figure out when `raw_ptr` methods fired in particular classes.



Fixed: 1523884

Change-Id: I37204bec43fba9be9eaf3ff3dbea1b407b5d87e2

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5271003

Owners-Override: Keishi Hattori

entry.title: [lacros skew tests] Refresh skew tests for M123
entry.content:
This CL updates the ash version ['123.0.6284.0'] for Lacros version skew testing.

This cl only affect linux-lacros config builders like

linux-lacros-tester-rel, linux-lacros-rel.

This cl will certainly NOT affect Lacros on-device builders

This reland fixs the unit tests crashed issue with renaming the

template struct Conv2dTester that has existed in ml_graph_test.cc [1]

> [WebNN][CrOS]: Support explicit padding for Conv2d/Pool2d

entry.title: Make SharedDictionaryStorage handle match-dest correctly
entry.content:
This CL introduces the logic of checking the destination while finding a

matching dictionary.



`SharedDictionaryStorage::GetDictionary()` is called from the

constructor of `CorsURLLoader` to start loading the dictionary as

soon as possible. `SharedDictionaryStorage::GetDictionarySync()` is

called from `SharedDictionaryNetworkTransaction` which uses the returned

dictionary.



This CL adds a new `destination` argument to `GetDictionary()` method

and `GetDictionarySync()` method. And these methods will check the

destination for finding the matching dictionary.



To implement the destination aware finding dictionary logic, this CL

changes the way of holding the dictionary information in

SharedDictionaryStorage(InMemory/OnDisk) class.

Currently the dictionary information is loaded into a map

`dictionary_info_map_` which is a map of SchemeHostPort to a map of

`match` string to the dictionary information:

std::map>

dictionary_info_map_;

This CL changes it to a map of SchemeHostPort to a map of `match` string

and set of destinations to the dictionary information:

std::map<

url::SchemeHostPort,

std::map
std::set>,

DictionaryInfo>>

dictionary_info_map_;



Bug: 1413922

Change-Id: Id980061626567e2d9f8bba43520cdba59ba2f2e8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5267680

Reviewed-by: Patrick Meenan

Commit-Queue: Tsuyoshi Horo

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1256631}

entry.title: Parse id and mach-dest option in use-as-dictionary response header
entry.content:
This CL introduces "id" field and "match-dest" field parsing logic.



Those two fields are parsed only when V2 backend is enabled.

Values in those fields are stored only in the InMemory backend storage.

We will implement the storing logic in the OnDisk backend later.



Those values in those fields doesn't have any effect on Chromium's

behavior yet. The logic for setting "Dictionary-ID" request header, and

the logic for checking the request destination while finding a matching

dictionary will also be implemented later.

entry.title: WebNN: Make the destructor of MLOperator class virtual
entry.content:
In the case where we create many derived classes that inherit from

MLOperator class, it is better to declare the destructor of the

MLOperator class as a virtual function to ensure that the destructor of

the derived class is called correctly when deleting the derived class

object through the MLOperator class pointer.

files. However, none of the classes or functions in the

BUILD.gn definition is not necessary.

entry.content:
PickerClient::DownloadGifToString takes in a url and validates it.

GIF url.

URL validation check.

entry.title: Tentative fix for objects being allocated on top of each other
entry.content:
There are indications that somehow, objects in persistent memory are

being allocated on top of each other. For example, histogram objects

in persistent memory have a pointer to their samples vector. Crash

reports show that sometimes, the pointers point to 0xC8799269. This is

typically not a valid memory location. Rather, it's a magic number in

persistent memory code when allocating a new object. So, somehow, a

new object was allocated on top of the histogram object, and

0xC8799269 was written to where an histogram object stores a pointer

to its samples.



The persistent memory allocator has a "freeptr", which is what keeps

track of where to allocate a new object. Assuming the aforementioned

issue isn't caused by some generic memory corruption due to hardware

(which is unlikely due to the sheer number of crash reports for this

problem), then somehow freeptr must be getting decreased in value (it

is supposed to be strictly increasing). This would result in the next

new object being allocated on top of where an object was already

allocated.

There are only two places in the code base where we update "freeptr":

1. When allocating a new object.

2. When initializing the persistent memory.

The code surrounding case 1 is tricky, but I've read it a million

times and can't find any race conditions. I've also read the assembly

code to see if a compiler optimization might be creating a race

condition, but couldn't find anything there either.

As for case 2, it should theoretically not be possible, as it would

require two processes to be working with the same persistent file.

This shouldn't be possible because we protect against this using

timestamps and PIDs to generate unique filenames. However, assuming

that there is somehow a way for two processes to be working with the

same file, then there is a very small window where "freeptr" would

get decremented/"rewinded". This CL tentatively fixes this to see if

this has an effect. In my opinion, this is unlikely to be the cause

since the race window is so small, but this will let us rule it out

with certainty.





Bug: 1432981

Change-Id: I3caf61b4cba0a58b099e24a7f6ca61b2d7b7f794

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5269743

Commit-Queue: Alexei Svitkine

Reviewed-by: Alexei Svitkine

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1256589}

entry.title: Allow ChildProcessMitigationLowBox test to run on Win11 ARM64 debug
entry.content:
On Win11 ARM64 emitting a DPLOG eventually causes the Csrss heap

to be accessed by Windows libraries. As tests run in Csrss lockdown

and failing to launch a process causes a DPLOG this means that this

test that expects to fail to launch a process cannot run in Win11

ARM64 debug configurations unless we disable Csrss lockdown for

this configuration.



Fixed: 1523707

Change-Id: I36f1bd1ee2e7ad990817b813ec00e7be69bbd7d5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5260985

entry.title: viz: Refactor GpuVSyncBFS to be Windows only
entry.content:
Rename GpuVSyncBeginFrameSource to ExternalBeginFrameSourceWin and have

it directly talk to the VSyncThreadWin which allows us to remove several

layers of plumbing between the BFS and Presenter.



Minor cleanup of VSyncThreadWin to not use base::Singleton and use the

IDXGIDevice associated with DComp instead of assuming that it's always

the ANGLE D3D11 device. Also move the VSyncObserver interface into

VSyncThreadWin since that's the only place it's used.



No functional change is intended.



Bug: 1517690

entry.title: Don’t adjust floated bounds when detached
entry.content:
This CL makes CCState do nothing if the window has no parent when a

workspace event happens. Otherwise, `FloatController::GetFloatWindow*`

crashes.

A window may have no parent when it’s being reparented to another

container.



BUG=b:322374826

TEST=ClientControlledStateTestClamshellAndTablet.ReplaceFloatedWindowWithFullscreenWindow
